instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no internal display only external display works
threads.message: This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board chimes like a bird but works from external monitor using HDMI  you could use the computer normal which is weird but the screen is not recognize not even back light doesn't work or no image when testing voltage for on <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> two missing voltage <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>  and <SIGNAL>BKL_FET_CNTL</SIGNAL> even when you put voltage to <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> am  still missing  <SIGNAL>BKL_FET_CNTL</SIGNAL> but before i go to far when you turn on the mother board just for about 5 seconds you get  on the LCD cable  <SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> 1.3v /<SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUX_P</SIGNAL> 1.6v /<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 5v/ <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> 3.3v /<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> 2.8v/ but i don't get  <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0.v  when I jump  <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> i get only 12.v on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> one strange thing is on <CAPACITOR>C9028</CAPACITOR> /<CAPACITOR>C9029</CAPACITOR> toward the CPU is short toward each other but still gives voltage when you just turn on the motherboard   on a good board there is no short on those caps. Things i replace LCD connector /<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> tried two different screens / replace resistors around <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> check diode mode all good reading and even replace <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> from <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>  and over kill still all the same even did pram reset  and smc lid is working any help is needed maybe i miss some thing or i may have left out something i did and forgot to write it on this post  thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no internal display only external display works
threads.message:
"maybe i miss some thing"
Exactly, you've made the wrong assumption considering the backlight comes first.
Backlight MUST stay off, until image appears (and get stable); is the only way to avoid artefacts on the screen.

If <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> comes high, PCH should recognize LCD.
If this signal disappears in 5s, something went wrong with PCH-display communication and LCD 5V voltage will go off too.

Any history available?
Check <CAPACITOR>C9028</CAPACITOR>/29 and traces.
Be sure to test with known good COMPATIBLE display.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no internal display only external display works
threads.message: the mother boots with image on the external screen only  and image comes before back light this might be a type on my part  i type incorrectly the history on the board it had no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>  and no chime only fan spinning with amber light i change <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> now i have <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> with chime  but only display on external monitor not internal screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no internal display only external display works
threads.message:
Please, post accurate information.
Do you get image on internal screen, only missing backlight???
If 5V not steady at pins 28-30 of J9000, you cannot have image.
Of course, no reason to search for backlight in such case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no internal display only external display works
threads.message:
Pay atention to my posts.
I already explained you, no reason to search for backlight, if you do not even get image on internal screen.
You wasted lot of time digging into backlight circuit, for no reason.
Steady 5V at L9000 is a mandatory step, explained too.

threads.message: i understand that i was saying i have no image and no back light on the screen and 5v comes for 5 second then disappear the only way for me to use the computer is with and external monitor i want to know what can cause the  5v to stop working  so fast on l9000

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no internal display only external display works
threads.message:
"If <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> comes high, PCH should recognize LCD.
If this signal disappears in 5s, something went wrong with PCH-display communication and LCD 5V voltage will go off too.
-------------------
Check <CAPACITOR>C9028</CAPACITOR>/29 and traces.
Be sure to test with known good COMPATIBLE display."
